intro: Hesperis pusilla, commonly known as the small candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Hesperis pusilla is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
